sloka: I meditate upon the feet of my guru (śaṅkara). Oh! śaṅkara, I take refuge in you,  one well versed in the śāstras and a reservoir of knowledge contained in the upaniṣads.
Oh Compassionate guru, protect me who is inundated with suffering in this world. Make me into a knower of the purport of the śāstras. Oh! śaṅkara, I take refuge in you.
Oh Contemplator of ātma, men become content by you (your teachings). Make me a discerner of īśvara​: and jīva​:. Oh! śaṅkara, I take refuge in you.
I've realized that you are īśvara​: verily. Dissuade me from moha (delusion/infatuation with saṃsāra). Oh! śaṅkara, I take refuge in you.
